channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Madonna at the BBC
channel.desc: A look back at a selection of magical Madonna moments on various BBC shows, from her first Top of the Pops appearance with Holiday in 1984 right up to the present day.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Tina Turner at the BBC
channel.desc: A collection of performances from one of the greatest singers and live performers in modern music - the legendary Tina Turner.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: David Bowie at the BBC Radio Theatre
channel.desc: Songs include Ashes to Ashes, Absolute Beginners, The Man Who Sold the World and Fame. Contains scenes of flashing images.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 23 January 1998 and featuring Peter Andre, Lighthouse Family, Radiohead, OTT, Ian Brown, Backstreet Boys and Oasis.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 30 January 1998 and featuring All Saints, Chumbawamba, Robbie Williams, Catatonia, Juliet Roberts, Green Day and Usher.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Gary Davies presents this pop chart programme, featuring Bucks Fizz, Nu Shooz, Amazulu, A-ha, The Housemartins, Doctor & The Medics, Miami Sound Machine, Queen and Owen Paul.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: David Hamilton presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 24 June 1976 and featuring Pilot, The New Seekers, Johnny Nash, Lee Garrett, Art Garfunkel, The Real Thing and The Beach Boys.

channel.title: The Flying Gardener
channel.desc: Chris Beardshaw travels to both Devon and Cornwall to discover how plants survive in the most exposed areas of Britain, and he transforms a local resident's balcony using miniatures and bonsai.

channel.desc: Helen is finally up and about - only to face the morning after the chaos of Tristan's party the night before.

channel.desc: The Herriots prepare to move to Rowangarth, and there's another emergency with Granville Bennett.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Saint Omer
channel.desc: Pregnant young novelist Rama attends the trial of Laurence Coly, a Senegalese woman accused of murdering her 15-month-old child by leaving her on a beach to be swept away.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Scrublands
channel.desc: Journalist Martin Scarsden investigates the shooting of five parishioners by a priest. Contains strong language, some violence and upsetting scenes.

channel.title: Scrublands
channel.desc: Martin decides to stay on in Riversend to dig deeper into the mystery of Byron Swift. Contains strong language and some violent scenes.

channel.desc: Tom and Barbara are visited by the press, and Margo senses an opportunity to promote her upcoming dramatic production.

channel.desc: Cellist Sheku Kanneh-Mason talks to John Wilson about his formative influences, including his paternal grandfather, Jacqueline du Pr?, Mstislav Rostropovich and Bob Marley.

channel.desc: Superstar siblings Sheku and Braimah, with Brazilian guitarist Pl?nio Fernandes and the dynamic Fantasia Orchestra perform an eclectic and surprising mix from Brahms to Bob Marley.

channel.title: Windrush
channel.desc: Following a remarkable project spearheaded by the King, this documentary sees leading artists create portraits of pioneering members of the Windrush Generation.

channel.title: The Richard Dimbleby Lecture with David Harewood
channel.desc: Acclaimed actor David Harewood OBE delivers the 2023 Richard Dimbleby Lecture.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Being Beethoven
channel.desc: Beethoven embarks on a new creative path and attempts to find love. But, as is often the case, the composer's life appears to be following a very different trajectory to his art.

channel.title: Burma, My Father and the Forgotten Army

channel.title: Secrets of Skin

channel.desc: A family must adapt to a new life after a devastating storm forces them from their home.
